author: amos gamer
comment: I love it!

author: Tom Joyce
comment: This app is so great. I love it. Thank goodness there is no way to put stuff podcasts on your watch. The Bluetooth works very well and I am impressed with the sound quality. It is a little clunky to get podcasts onto the watch, but you can just plug in any RSS URL and it works

author: Aseem behl
comment: Works without flaws. A must have app for android wear. Many thanks to the developer. Feature request: Option to trim silence during podcasts would be great!

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: You have good taste in apps, my friend.

comment: Two stars because, yes, it will play podcasts.  There is no basic search function, which renders this next to useless if you cannot find the podcasts you want in the top lists.

author: Ruben Garcia
comment: Awesome app to send podcasts to my android watch and it automatically downloads new podcasts once added.
Hmmm not sure. I cannot see the app on the Sony Smartwatch3. Tried to send files to the watch but nothing.

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: If you didn't get an a!ert on your watch to install the app, you need to go to the Play Store on your watch and install it from there. I heard Sony watches may not be running the Play Store however, due to a decision by Sony. Google recently made it mandatory to have a separate watch and phone apk for Android Wear but maybe Sony didn't get the memo

author: ambrose demo
comment: works on the tic watch.  works great. will pay $ for a speed adjustment feature

author: Fionn Anderson
comment: Needs a search function

author: Brian McGarry
comment: I don't understand why it's taken so long to get a standalone podcast app for AW. I can now go on runs without taking my phone along. The app is looking pretty good for being so new. Would like some way to sync with podcast apps on phone or to even read/transfer podcast episodes already downloaded to the phone. Also, changing playback speed. Keep up the great work.

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Thanks for the review. Syncing with other podcast apps isn't possible unless those podcasts app create an API or interface to allow syncing (which isn't in their best interest).  Also, whatever podcast is playing on your watch can be played on your phone.

author: Ralph Basile
comment: Since the latest update, will not launch on my Moto Sport. I have tried uninstalling, reinstalling, rebooting, etc. Too bad. I was so excited to finally have a podcast program for Android Wear! Hoping they fix this soon.  Well happy to report I heard from the publisher again and he seems to have fixed the issue with the latest update (uploaded today). I loaded, the app launched and I was able to download a podcast and begin listening. Hope to go for a run later today and put it through the real trial.   But I appreciate the quick response! As I mentioned, I have been hoping for an app like this since Android Wear launched!

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Can you send an email to krisdb@live.com?  It will be easier to work through the issue then through here.  Can you check if you're running version 1.12b by going to Settings - Apps - "Wear Casts" - "App Info" on your watch.  Previous version were breaking on watches that had a "chin", like the Moto Sport.  1.12b should fix the issue

author: Jeff McLaughlin
comment: Super helpful way to listen to podcasts on a walk or run without being tethered to a phone.

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: It's the future of mobile technology!

author: Randy Rowles
comment: Love it!

author: Colin MacDonald
comment: Fantastic work, this will finally make my watch a standalone running device. It's a shame that the only way to get fast downloads is to disable Bluetooth but I understand this is an Android wear limitation. Great app.

author: Bruce Wong
comment: Good app! It's a great start! My biggest issue is that it freezes and crashes at the Downloads auto playlist page. Keep up the good work!  5 stars for developer responsiveness!

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Thanks for the review.  Try disabling Bluetooth and downloading over Wifi.  Downloading over Bluetooth is very slow and unreliable but that's not something I have any control over, unfortunately.

author: Your DaD
comment: Simply amazing and works wonderfully in my hwatch

author: Zac Lloyd
comment: Finally a stand alone podcast app!  Kudos to krisdb for meeting this need.  My polar m600 running watch is reborn!

author: Andy Wiener
comment: The only standalone podcast app for Android Wear. The functionality is great. Developer is very responsive.

author: Paradorn Suksingha
comment: Thanks so much for the app. Looking for this kind of stand alone app for my Polar M600 for long time.  One question. How can I delete podcast I manually added to the watch?

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: You can delete a downloaded podcast by either long-pressing on the episode in the "Downloads" list or via the menu option on the episode screen (the screen with the play/pause button).

author: Ray Dar
comment: So close! The one thing this is really needing is to be able to "Share" an episode file from another podcast app, such as Podcast Addict. This would let people easily transfer a few episodes to the watch before heading out (without having to manage subscriptions in multiple places).

author: Tom Johnson
comment: Finally, a standalone podcast player for AW.  I use is it when I go running in the AM with my LG Watch Sport.  Only thing I wish... Which would go 5*, is to auto download a podcast episode...or say 3. You have to manually do this right now for each you want. (EDIT:  Just found out you can auto download episodes by long pressing on the episode folder.  Yippie!  5-stars!)

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Thanks for the review.  Long press on each podcast and there is an option to auto download each new episode.

author: Arjun Asokan
comment: Initially was super excited about this app but it's kinda finicky. The download feature is very hit or miss, sometimes it works great sometimes it just stops or downloads multiple copies. App also sometimes just drops new episodes from list and I can't get them to come back until I restart the phone.

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback.  The app is still in beta, so there may be some small bugs.  I have found disabling Bluetooth on the watch while downloading helps with download speed and reliability.  By default Android Wear will use your phone's Internet, over Bluetooth, which is significantly slower, then direct wifi.

comment: This is the right direction for podcast apps on Android Wear. I think you should be able to push podcasts to the watch from the phone app though. Also, consider connecting to a podcast directory service to make searching easier.

reply.author: krisdb
reply.content: Thanks for the review. You can import an OPML or enter in podcasts manually through the menu on the phone app.

author: Mike Francis
comment: Love this app!. I've been looking for a solid month for a wear app that steams podcasts standalone. This is the only app that does it. Needs UX work but basics are all there. Thanks.

author: mohammad ghaderi
comment: Good
